messageBody:
Could you elaborate a bit?

A therory should behave the same for all datapoints - assumptions. Do
you expect all cases to throw an exception or only some of them?

In the latter case a datadriven test is probably a better fit. In the
former I assume you have to fall back to the old JUnit3 way (I assume
you have already looked for a Theory(expected=SomeException.class)
attribute, I can't check right now). Anyway, the JUnit3 way:

@Theory
public void shouldThrowExceptionInExceptionalCases(Input inThisCase) {
assumeTrue(inThisCase, isAnExceptionalCase()); // or maybe
assumeTrue(isAnExceptionalCase(inThisCase))
try {
anInstance.withAMethodThatThrowsAnException(inThisCase);
fail("the expected exception was never thrown");
}
catch(ExpectedException e) {
// you may or you may not want to assert something here like
assertThat(e.getMessage(), is(not(null))) or similar.
}
}

The above is a bit meta but I hope it helps anyway.
/J
